meanings.definition: Existing at or dating from birth.
meanings.sent1: The congenitally blind puppy navigated the room with ease.
meanings.sent2: She has a congenitally cheerful disposition that brightens everyone's day.
meanings.sent3: The congenitally early riser was always the first one at the breakfast table.
meanings.sent4: His congenitally shy nature made it challenging for him to speak up in class.
meanings.sent5: The congenitally curious child explored every nook and cranny of the garden.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is present at birth.
meanings.sent1: The baby was congenitally calm, rarely crying or fussing.
meanings.sent2: She congenitally preferred sweet foods over savory ones.
meanings.sent3: The kitten congenitally purred loudly as soon as it was born.
meanings.sent4: He congenitally slept through the night from the moment he was born.
meanings.sent5: The flowers congenitally bloomed in vibrant colors every spring.

meanings.definition: In a way that is innate or inherent.
meanings.sent1: She congenitally understood complex mathematical concepts with ease.
meanings.sent2: His congenitally kind heart always led him to help those in need.
meanings.sent3: The artist congenitally saw beauty in the smallest details of life.
meanings.sent4: The athlete was congenitally gifted with exceptional speed and agility.
meanings.sent5: The musician congenitally felt the rhythm of the music in their soul.
